content.description: It trends left up and over rolling hills of granite. This is a great climb with the start being tricky. Bear hug the granite then use sidepulls to crimps. You do get intermittent rests with some creative balancing used mostly by circus trapeze artists. Overall a very fun climb.
content.location: This is left of Uncensored Society. It appears to be new so more information would be great to have. I'm guessing on the rating. It may be 10d.
left of drunk punk oi on corner

content.description: Crimpy sideways holds with funky footwork. A bueno little package of climbing. Like a bolted Little Cottonwood boulder problem. Andale!
content.protection:
Bring a few draws for the bolts.  Getting to the first bolt can be spicy, it can be stick-clipped (but it won't be as proud as going ground up in lycra tights).

There are bolted chain anchors on the ledge above.  Read Drew's comments below regarding extra pieces above the last bolt to reduce the potential monster ripper if you blow it on the 5.9 finish.
content.location: Total Ramon is to the left of Scratchin' for the Loomer, which both rise from the slope around the corner and uphill from the flat spot below Fortress..

content.description:
Beautiful face and crack climbing on upper wall above and left of  Ramon and Loomer. Great continuous climbing protected with small TCUs (no bolts). Really cool features, the climbing on the upper wall is stellar.

Easy to TR from new sport route to the left (shares anchors).
content.protection: Doubles of purple, blue, and yellow TCUs. Bring some bigger stuff for the approach crack. Bolted anchors with chains. Be prepared for an easy runout (9+/10-) to chains above a purple TCU (one could clip last bolt on sport route to the left if desperately pumped).
content.location: Starts in obvious crack chimney left of Total Ramon. Climb up through easier blocky terrain to thin crack system that splits the right side of the upper wall. A 60m rope will get you down.

content.description: Got your footwork dialed? Test your sticky rubber on this thing. Either a frustrating effort or a beautiful dance requiring Zen-like focus.
content.protection: Four bolts with bolted chain anchors shared with Total Ramon to the left.
content.location: The first bolted route you come to around the corner and uphill from the flat area below Fortress.

content.description: La cerveza de Costa Rica. Fun climbing mixes face and flake holds. Stay more left to make it a bit harder, or go more right to ease off.  Props and thanks to Kelley Bethea for being a big part of this route's creation.
content.location: Right/downhill of Scratchin' for the Loomer

content.description: This little shredder climbs patina and pinches past four bolts to a two bolt belay. Not that the climbing goes that way, but the left arete and gully are off route. Props and thanks to Kelley Bethea for being a big part of this route's creation.
content.location: Starts just left/uphill of Total Ramon.

content.description:
9 bolts  + Anchors

shares first 3 bolts with 'DeHumanized 5.11a **' (which then moves left)

content.protection: 6 bolts & finger to fist size cams to right side anchors
content.location: same start as drunk punk oi first 3 bolts then stay left to the 4th bolt then gear & finish 2 more bolts to right anchors

content.description: Longish, steep and juggy, open-handed climb that ends on anchors above 'Steel Reserve'
content.location: just up the slope to (newly) leveled area...about 20-30 ft. uphill from 'Total Ramon' and 50-60 ft. uphill from 'Fortress' flat spot...

content.description:
Really a variation to Uncensored Society. Climb to the first bolt on that route and then go straight right to the Condor crux. Surmounting that move puts the leader in a small right-facing corner. Follow this feature for four more bolts before rejoining Uncensored Society.

NOTE: the route name - depending on your wingspan, the grade could vary a great deal. Props and thanks to Kelley Bethea for being a big part of this route's creation.
content.location: Right of Uncensored Society and left of Drunk Punk Oi.
